text: École du Louvre it is a public institution of French higher education located in the Louvre Palace in Paris and teaches art history studies.Décret n°97-1085 du 25 novembre 1997 relatif à l'Ecole du Louvre Founded in 1882 in one of the parts of the Louvre Museum, from an institution originally devised to study archeology, it became an institution covering the entire art history.Les services de l'administration centrale Direction des musées de France It is organisationally and administratively dependent on the French Ministry of Culture and has been a public body since 1997.L’école du Louvre multiplie les doubles diplômes == Notable Former Students == * Louise Bourgeois, French- American artist * Anne-Aymone Giscard d'Estaing, widow of 20th President of France Valéry Giscard d'Estaing * Miúcha, Brazilian singer and composer == References == == Further reading == * Official website Category:Universities in Paris Category:1882 establishments in Europe Category:1880s establishments in France
